pikachu: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
raichu: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
jigglypuff: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
wigglytuff: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
venonat: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.
venomoth: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
diglett: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
dugtrio: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
meowth: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
persian: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
psyduck: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
golduck: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
mankey: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
primeape: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
growlithe: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
arcanine: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.
slowpoke: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
slowbro: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
magnemite: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
magneton: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
grimer: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
muk: It's thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
shellder: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
cloyster: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
gastly: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
haunter: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
gengar: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
drowzee: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.
hypno: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
voltorb: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
electrode: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
chansey: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
scyther: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
tauros: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
magikarp: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
gyarados: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
ditto: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.
eevee: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.
vaporeon: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.
jolteon: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
flareon: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
dratini: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
dragonair: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
dragonite: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
pichu: It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.
igglybuff: Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.
mareep: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
flaaffy: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
ampharos: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.
marill: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.
azumarill: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.
sudowoodo: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
hoppip: This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.
skiploom: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon's head.
jumpluff: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.
sunkern: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. Knowing it's weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.
sunflora: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
espeon: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent's next move.
umbreon: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.
murkrow: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
slowking: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's head and unlocked an extraordinary power.
misdreavus: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
girafarig: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
pineco: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.
forretress: It's usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.
dunsparce: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.
qwilfish: Be cautious if this Pokémon starts sucking in water—it will soon attack by scattering the toxic spikes that grow all over its body.
scizor: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.
heracross: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
sneasel: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.
teddiursa: This Pokémon discreetly follows Combee to find their hive. It scoops up big dollops of honey in its palms to eat.
ursaring: It usually wears a hardened expression, but when it's licking up honey—which it loves—the joy it feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.
delibird: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
houndour: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.
houndoom: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.
phanpy: This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won't be able to settle down unless it washes its body.
donphan: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won't faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.
stantler: This Pokémon apparently used to live in much harsher environments, and thus it once had stronger psychic powers than it does now.
blissey: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
larvitar: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
pupitar: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.
tyranitar: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.
wingull: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
pelipper: It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.
ralts: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.
kirlia: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
gardevoir: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.
surskit: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
masquerain: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction—to and fro and sideways.
shroomish: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.
breloom: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.
slakoth: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.
vigoroth: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
slaking: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
makuhita: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.
hariyama: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.
azurill: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
sableye: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.
meditite: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.
medicham: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.
gulpin: There is nothing its stomach can't digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
swalot: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
numel: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.
camerupt: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.
torkoal: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
spoink: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.
grumpig: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
cacnea: It prefers harsh environments, such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.
cacturne: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.
swablu: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
altaria: If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.
zangoose: It's Seviper's archrival. To threaten those it encounters, it fans out the claws on its front paws.
seviper: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
barboach: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.
whiscash: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.
shuppet: It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.
banette: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.
tropius: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.
snorunt: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.
glalie: Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the cold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While they're in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.
luvdisc: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.
bagon: Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders. It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it can fly.
shelgon: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
salamence: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up everything it passes over.
starly: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
staravia: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
staraptor: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
kricketot: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
kricketune: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
shinx: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
luxio: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
luxray: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
combee: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.
vespiquen: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
pachirisu: It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
buizel: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
floatzel: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
shellos: It used to have a shell on its back long ago. This species is closely related to Pokémon like Shellder.
gastrodon: Its whole body is sticky with mucus. In the past, this form of Gastrodon was by far the more numerous one.
drifloon: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.
drifblim: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.
mismagius: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
honchkrow: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.
stunky: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
skuntank: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
bronzor: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.
bronzong: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
bonsly: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.
happiny: It carries a round, white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
spiritomb: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
gible: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
gabite: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
garchomp: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
riolu: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
lucario: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.
hippopotas: It shuts its nostrils tight, then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
hippowdon: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
croagunk: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
toxicroak: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
finneon: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
lumineon: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
snover: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
abomasnow: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
weavile: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
magnezone: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
leafeon: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
glaceon: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
gallade: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
froslass: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
rotom: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
petilil: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
lilligant: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
basculin: Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokémon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.
sandile: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
krokorok: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
krookodile: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
zorua: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
zoroark: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
gothita: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
gothorita: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
gothitelle: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe's end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.
deerling: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In early spring, these Pokémon give off a delicate, sweet, and calming scent.
sawsbuck: It seems that a Sawsbuck with many flowers on its antlers will grow at a slightly slower pace because the flowers absorb the Pokémon's nutrients.
foongus: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
amoonguss: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss's caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
alomomola: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
tynamo: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
eelektrik: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
eelektross: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
axew: This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
fraxure: Because its tusks don't grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won't use them unless truly necessary.
haxorus: This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
cubchoo: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there's a chance it is sick.
beartic: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.
cryogonal: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.
pawniard: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.
bisharp: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
rufflet: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
braviary: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
deino: It can't see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
zweilous: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don't give each head the same amount of attention, they'll begin fighting out of jealousy.
hydreigon: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
larvesta: This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.
volcarona: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.
fletchling: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
fletchinder: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
talonflame: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
scatterbug: Any poison this Pokémon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. That's why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.
spewpa: If Rufflet attacks this Pokémon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.
vivillon: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from frigid lands.
litleo: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
pyroar: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It's thanks to them that their pride doesn't starve.
flabebe: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.
floette: This Pokémon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.
florges: This Pokémon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.
skiddo: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.
gogoat: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.
skrelp: Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.
dragalge: Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.
clauncher: This Pokémon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokémon.
clawitzer: Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.
sylveon: This Pokémon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.
hawlucha: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.
dedenne: It's small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people's homes and charge itself.
goomy: Most of a Goomy's body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokémon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.
sliggoo: The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.
goodra: It loves the rain. This mellow Pokémon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.
klefki: Once it absorbs a key's metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
bergmite: They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.
avalugg: As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.
noibat: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.
noivern: Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokémon has a cruel disposition.
yungoos: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
gumshoos: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
crabrawler: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
crabominable: The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.
oricorio: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
rockruff: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
lycanroc: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.
mareanie: This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
toxapex: This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.
mudbray: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won't dry out even if it's exposed to the sun for a long time.
mudsdale: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
fomantis: Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
lurantis: By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
salandit: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
salazzle: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.
bounsweet: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
steenee: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.
tsareena: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.
oranguru: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.
passimian: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won't obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.
sandygast: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else— like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
palossand: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
komala: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.
mimikyu: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
bruxish: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
skwovet: It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.
greedent: If it spots a berry tree, it will immediately go to gather berries without a sideways glance—even if it's in the middle of a battle.
rookidee: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee's eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.
corvisquire: It's said that the reason behind Corvisquire's high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokémon.
corviknight: Corviknight can't serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokémon's natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.
chewtle: Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another Chewtle's horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.
drednaw: Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokémon has an extremely vicious disposition.
rolycoly: On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.
carkol: The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.
coalossal: To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.
applin: It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apple's skin and prevent it from rotting.
flapple: It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponent's guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.
appletun: It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.
silicobra: Silicobra's neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.
sandaconda: It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.
arrokuda: Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.
barraskewda: It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the water's surface.
toxel: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel's body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.
toxtricity: As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.
sinistea: The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.
polteageist: The tea that composes Polteageist's body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.
hatenna: Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokémon prefers environments where no other creatures live.
hattrem: To this Pokémon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noises—even if the emotions are happy ones.
hatterene: Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.
impidimp: The reason this Pokémon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it can't absorb negative emotions.
morgrem: Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesn't have confidence in its brawn.
grimmsnarl: This Pokémon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.
falinks: The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.
pincurchin: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
snom: It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.
frosmoth: Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.
stonjourner: The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokémon's habitat.
eiscue: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
indeedee: This Pokémon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.
cufant: Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.
copperajah: This Pokémon was brought to Paldea long ago by people from a faraway land. It's so strong that it can easily pull an airplane.
dreepy: In the evening, groups of Dreepy will fly at high speeds over the ocean and poke at Pokémon in the water for fun.
drakloak: This Pokémon flies around at over 120 miles per hour. If a Drakloak is defeated in a battle, its Dreepy will wander off without a second thought.
dragapult: Dragapult can make its whole body transparent by clearing its mind and focusing. Even the Dreepy in Dragapult's horns become invisible.
sprigatito: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
floragato: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
meowscarada: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
fuecoco: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
crocalor: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.
skeledirge: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge's head gained a soul.
quaxly: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
quaxwell: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
quaquaval: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
lechonk: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.
oinkologne: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
dudunsparce: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
tarountula: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.
spidops: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
nymble: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
lokix: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
rellor: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
rabsca: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
greavard: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
houndstone: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
flittle: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.
espathra: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
farigiraf: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
wiglett: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
wugtrio: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
dondozo: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
veluza: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
finizen: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
palafin: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
smoliv: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
dolliv: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
arboliva: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
capsakid: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
scovillain: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
tadbulb: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
bellibolt: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
varoom: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
revavroom: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
orthworm: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
tandemaus: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
maushold: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.
cetoddle: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
cetitan: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
frigibax: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
arctibax: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
baxcalibur: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
tatsugiri: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
cyclizar: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
pawmi: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
pawmo: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
pawmot: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
wattrel: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
kilowattrel: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
bombirdier: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon's chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
squawkabilly: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
flamigo: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
klawf: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
nacli: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
naclstack: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.
garganacl: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
glimmet: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
glimmora: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
shroodle: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
grafaiai: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
fidough: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.
dachsbun: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
maschiff: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.
mabosstiff: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
bramblin: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
brambleghast: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
gimmighoul: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.
gholdengo: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
greattusk: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
brutebonnet: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
sandyshocks: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
screamtail: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
fluttermane: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
slitherwing: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
roaringmoon: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
irontreads: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
ironmoth: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
ironhands: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
ironjugulis: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
ironthorns: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
ironbundle: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
ironvaliant: It has some similarities to a mad scientist's invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
tinglu: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
chienpao: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
wochien: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king's evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
chiyu: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
koraidon: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
miraidon: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
tinkatink: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
tinkatuff: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
tinkaton: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
charcadet: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
armarouge: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
ceruledge: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
toedscool: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
toedscruel: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
kingambit: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
clodsire: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.
annihilape: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
